question_text:
A company has an on-premises application that generates a large amount of time-sensitive data that is backed up to Amazon S3. The application has grown and there are user complaints about internet bandwidth limitations. A solutions architect needs to design a long-term solution that allows for both timely backups to Amazon S3 and with minimal impact on internet connectivity for internal users.
Which solution meets these requirements?

options.A: Establish AWS VPN connections and proxy all traffic through a VPC gateway endpoint.
options.B: Establish a new AWS Direct Connect connection and direct backup traffic through this new connection.
options.C: Order daily AWS Snowball devices. Load the data onto the Snowball devices and return the devices to AWS each day.
options.D: Submit a support ticket through the AWS Management Console. Request the removal of S3 service limits from the account.
